title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message:
I have an 820-00928 board with no display and no backlight on the internal after liquid damage. The internal display does not show up in osx.
Tested with known good screen and cable

Has PP3V3_S0SW_LCD
BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN
PP5V_S0SW_LCD
I2C_BKLT_SDA
I2C_BKLT_SCL
after checking the LCD connector against a known good board with diode mode i found Issues linked to u9850
EDP_AUXCH_C_N OL
EDP_AUXCH_C_P OL

I replaced the U9850 Mux with one from a donor 3787 (isnt a programmed chip i dont think, so it shouldnt make a difference) and the diode mode readings are now okay on those two lines.
Still no internal display,

All other diode mode readings seem pretty perfect on on the LVDS connector now.
Im struggling to figure out why it wont recognise the internal display. Any help would be awesome!

title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message: U9800 certainly has firmware, get a donor board.

title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 39341"]U9800 certainly has firmware, get a donor board.[/QUOTE]

I mistyped the Post. I replaced U9850 (2/1 Mux) due to bad diode mode readings to that mux. U9800 remains untouched.

title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message:
Check diode mode readings again on both AUX pins. Inspect the LCD cable closely as many times it has burned between the backlight pin and AUX pin. This will also have destroyed the connector on the board or LCD.

Did you use a CBTL type MUX? On some 3787 board alternate part numbers were used and they may not work. Make sure it says 6142 on the MUX.

title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message: Changed to a 6142 MUX and no change in symptoms. Doesnt see the internal display in OSX.

title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message:
Also now replaced u9800 (from scrap board) 
No change, still no internal display in OS.

Starting to go a bit loopy on this board.

PP5V_S0_SW_LCD = 5v
PP3v3_S0_SW_LCD = 3v3
BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN = 3v3

Im starting to wonder if the SMBUS lines have a problem. Anyone have any ideas?

title: 820-00928-A No display on internal (works external)
message:
Post DP_INT_HPD_R and LCD_IRQ_L.
Which pins of LCD connecter found to be affected by liquid?
